fields.description: Currently, Bitbucket wiki pages can support a range of different markup languages (https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Using+a+Bitbucket+Wiki) but pages ALWAYS start/default to Markdown and each page must be manually changed.  It would be nice to have a repository administrative setting to set a wiki-wide markup language.

fields.description:
I have a weird behavior in my repository. I had a folder called "RSEQ.Application" and at some point I renamed that folder locally to "Rseq.Application".

When browsing the source from bitbucket, I can now see 2 folders with the same name with only the text case being different (see attached image bitbucket.png).

Locally when the repository is pulled, everything ends up in a single folder name "Rseq.Application", but it makes it hard to browse code from the website.
fields.summary: Folder name "Case Sensitivity" (BB-8699)

fields.description:
In the Bitbucket "pull requests" screen (for any specific pull request), there is a "Learn about pull requests" help link.

Currently this incorrectly links to the BB documentation page about groups.  I expect you probably want it to link [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Working%2Bwith%2Bpull%2Brequests] instead?
fields.summary: Incorrect help link in pull request screen

Tried to import a repository to a new account, and failed. The following is the message I got.

Importing repository failed.

Remote Git clone failed: <class 'bitbucket.apps.async.tasks.ImportException'>: Command failed. Return value: 128
fields.summary: Importing repository failed

fields.description:
I have a repository with a branch that contains a # character, i.e. hotfix-#434

If I click on the branches icon on the right to reveal the list of branches and click on the branch it takes me to a URL with the # character unencoded and I get a 404, i.e.

https://bitbucket.org/brightmachine/reponame/commits/branch/hotfix-#434

If I encode the hash in the URL to get this:

https://bitbucket.org/brightmachine/reponame/commits/branch/hotfix-%23434

… then I get the page I was looking for.
fields.summary: Unencoded # in branch name (BB-7051)

fields.description: I think there is an error in the permissions bitbucket requests when linking a github account.  It wants access to update / modify / public *and private* repositories.  Shouldn't this be a more secure subset of the permissions available ?  This is a bit intrusive for just linking an account.
fields.summary: Bitbucket requests access to update Public and Private repos when linking a Github account (BB-8697)

fields.description:
For the past week or so the filter results have been odd. I finally determined that it is only taking into account self-owned repositories and ignores team-owned repositories.

This makes navigating our team's collection of 100 repositories majorly annoying if not entirely unusable.
fields.summary: dashboard "repositories filter" doesn't search team owned repositories any longer (BB-8696)

fields.description:
I'd like to propose the addition of superscripts and subscripts to the flavour of markdown the Bitbucket uses. Since Bitbucket uses python-markdown, there's a [plugin|https://github.com/sgraber/markdown.superscript] to enable superscripts with the markdown syntax of ^<superscript>^.

I'd suggest implementing subscripts as ^^<subscript>^^. Subscripts and superscripts are supported with Creole as the markup for wiki pages, but that support isn't there for markdown. It would really aid with writing technical wikis with footnotes.
fields.summary: Superscript/Subscript Implementation in Markdown (BB-8686)

Any suggestions on this?

fields.description:
I believe that I may have identified a bug in the link between the "Commits" page and the "Compare" page.

Symptoms/Reproduction

* My repository has a branch with a "+" symbol in it - specifically, at the end of the branch name - e.g. "TestBranch+".
* Open "Feature Branches" (through "Commits", then "Feature Branches")
* Find feature branch, click "Compare"
* Browser is redirected to a URL for the compare function that has a "+" symbol at the end, rather than the URL encoded "%2B".
* Browser displays page that states:\\
"need more than 1 value to unpack"

Expected Result

* User is taken to "Compare" page.
* URL is encoded properly.
fields.summary: Problem with Branches with "+" in them and Feature Branches -> Compare page link. (BB-8683)

When browsing bitbucket using whatever.mydomain.com and browsing the blame view for a given file, the links to individual commits point to

http://whatever.mydomain.com/myaccount/myrepository/commits/[commitnumber]

rather than

http://whatever.mydomain.com/myrepository/commits/[commitnumber]

(in other words myaccount gets added to the url, despite it being a custom domain)

Maybe, it should be added into "Connected accounts" section?

fields.summary: vk.com integration (Connected accounts)

fields.description:
Currently, to interact with the issue tracker, you need to be invited to the repository, thus counting against the available max-users limit of whatever plan you have. Assuming the intent is for the price plans to reflect the number of developers on the project, this does seem counterproductive, as a closed project either needs to pay for a priceplan counting every user and not just developer. Or, alternatively, find someplace else to communicate with users.

If it really is the intent to count users only participating issue tracking, the priceplans suddenly comes off as rather expensive.

My suggestion is to implement separate access rights for the repository itself and for the issue tracker, and only count users that are given any access to source (or more leniently are given write access to source).
fields.summary: Enable free access to issue tracker on private repos (BB-8680)

fields.description: has no menu "issues" in closed and open repository
fields.summary: Issues tracker don't exists in repositóry

fields.description: Recently, I changed my repository (jeadorf/luksctl) from private to public. The downloads are _still_ unavailable after several hours, the page reading _"We are currently updating the privacy flag for this repository's downloads. Try again soon"_. According to an [Atlassian answer|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/175910/how-long-are-downloads-unavailable-after-making-a-bitbucket-repository-public], this should take a couple of minutes.
fields.summary: Privacy flags not updated for downloads after making repository public

fields.description:
I'm using bitbucket for scientific code (using git) and publishing (using the wiki, currently with creole). Your wiki mostly renders quite nicely, and particularly, better than github, from which I'm migrating. Even more particularly :-) the bitbucket wiki handles subscripts and superscripts *much* better than github, which is important for documents about chemistry. However, I note that {code} #!HTML https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/aqmeii-na_n2o/wiki/N2O_emission_inventories_over_AQMEII-NA_2008 (source produced by your Creole engine) >

table of contents >

>
    >
  • N,,2,,O sources and sinks {code} !https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue-attachment/7495/site/master/1370012601.56/7495/bug.png! Note the subscript delimiters (commas) in the TOC link text are visible to the user, unlike the heading from which the TOC link is generated, which renders as intended. !https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue-attachment/7495/site/master/1370012561.68/7495/feature.png! The visibility of the delimiters in the TOC link text is a bug (no?) which I would prefer to be fixed either (in descending order of preference) by # rendering the TOC link text as a subscript, like its source heading currently does (e.g., 'N2O sources and sinks') # removing the subscript delimiters from the TOC link text, as they are currently removed from the TOC link target (e.g., 'N2O sources and sinks')
fields.summary: [wiki] subscript/superscript delimiters in TOC links (BB-8676)

fields.description:

under that team?

For example, we'd love to have hipchat notifications across all of our\\
repos, without needing to set it up on each one manually.

If we could do it in one place, that'd be amazing.
fields.summary: Shared team services across all repos

fields.description:
On an updated Mac OS X 10.8.3, both updated Safari and updated Chrome complain about the SSL certificate. In addition, the CLI git command also complains. According to the CA website: http://www.digicert.com/help/, both www.bitbucket.org and bitbucket.org return the error "Your server is not sending the right intermediate certificates." The error text reads:

*Your server is sending outdated intermediate certificates. For optimal performance and security, you should update the intermediate certificates on your server.

To resolve this problem, log in to your account, and re-download the intermediate certificates, then update your intermediate cert file on the server and restart the service.

If you are not sure how to do this, please contact DigiCert support by live chat, email at support@digicert.com, or phone at 801-701-9600.*
fields.summary: Intermediate certificate error from browsers and git client (BB-8736)

fields.description:
My team uses feature branches pushed to github to do code reviews. Sometimes the code review is denied and the developer has to resubmit work on a new branch. It seem that Jira smart commits watch all branches instead of just master, so that the #resolve smart commit tag is applied as soon as the code review branch is created, rather than when it's merged into the main corpus of code. This of course then shows an incorrect status on the Jira issue, since it's not actually resolved, just "pending" until the code is verified to actually work.

Is there any way to tell Jira to sync only one or two specific branches?
fields.summary: Seeking the ability sync only one or two specific branches (BB-8671)
RST codeblock directive doesn't have code highlighting (BB-8663)

Hello, develops :)

Limit to users in private repo is 5, it's OK.\\
I have 6 members in Team, include self.

In user [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Plans%2Band%2Bbilling] I saw:

_Team accounts include the members and other non-members with access. For a team account the *owner is not included* in the user limit._

But after I added sixth user (include him-self!), I see message:\\
"It's time for adlabs to upgrade to the next user level. Committers will have read-only access. Upgrade now."

And commiters team's now in Read-Only mode :(

I feel sad.

Thanks for replies.

Counting objects: 639, done.\\
Delta compression using up to 2 threads.\\
Compressing objects: 100% (628/628), done.\\
Read from remote host bitbucket.org: Connection reset by peer\\

error: pack-objects died with strange error\\
error: failed to push some refs to 'git@bitbucket.org:xxxxxxxxx/yyy.git'

(I have blanked out the repository name)

I can do 3 pushes in a row that end in this error, then the 4th will push successfully (as an example of how it sometimes works and sometimes doesn't).

I am not really sure what is causing it, and would appreciate any help you can provide.

Thank you,\\
Amanda.

git.exe push -v --progress  "origin" master:master

Pushing to https://iamsyt@bitbucket.org/learningosys/goserver.git

Counting objects: 241, done.

i have checked similar issues, and do the following before run "git push -u origin master" command as below:

fields.description:
*summary:* your wiki engine (Creoleparser) supports an {{<<include>>}} macro (per [this source|http://creoleparser.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/creoleparser/test_pages/CheatSheetPlus.txt] which renders to [this page|http://creoleparser.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/creoleparser/test_pages/CheatSheetPlus.html]). Please support that macro in the bitbucket wiki.

*details:*

I have a number of code repositories (e.g., [this|https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/aqmeii_ag_soil]) which are subsets of a larger thesis project. I wish to create a super-repo for thesis deliverables (e.g., articles, posters in LaTeX) that will point to and include items from, e.g., the code repos. I would also like to "rough out" those deliverables using the wiki (e.g., for communicating with my committee) rather than doing everything in LaTeX from the beginning, and communicating via large PDFs. This raises two problems, in order of increasing severity (as perceived by me):

# How to do interproject links? Unfortunately, bitbucket's Creole engine does not seem to support interproject links using the {{<<file>>}} syntax. Fortunately, I can just use the {{[[]]}} syntax and fully-qualified URIs (as in the next item in this list): not as clean (and I may eventually do an FR issue for interproject links), but HTML-style links will work for now.
# How to compose large wiki documents from smaller ones? For {version control, revision management} I would much prefer to be able to create files with smaller, more homogenous chunks of text (e.g., discussion of a specific model input) and _include_ them in a larger, templated document. Hence I was excited to see the use of the {{<<include>>}} macro in [the Creoleparser cheatsheet/demo source|http://creoleparser.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/creoleparser/test_pages/CheatSheetPlus.txt] which renders [as desired|http://creoleparser.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/creoleparser/test_pages/CheatSheetPlus.html]. However when I recreate the Creoleparser cheatsheet/demo source [in _my_ wiki|https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/aqmeii-na_n2o/wiki/CheatSheetPlus.wiki], it does not render as desired: rather, the macro text renders literally, in monospace.

Given that Creoleparser is your wiki engine (per [this page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Special%2BSupport%2Bfor%2BCreole]), and that Creoleparser supports {{<<include>>}}, I'm hoping it would be relatively easy to provide {{<<include>>}} on bitbucket. Note that I do not currently need the {{<<include-raw>>}} or {{<<include-source>>}} macros, though I can see how they would be useful (esp for your technical writers).
fields.summary: support Creoleparser macro=include (BB-8652)

fields.description: When bitbucket parses md-files it auto-assigning ids for header elements. If these elements are in english, then all is ok, but if its in russian, I get nothing. In what way I can assign proper IDs to headers in markdown files? Thanx.
fields.summary: HTML headers ID generation in markdown files (BB-8651)

fields.description:
Hi,

Is it possible to hide the "teams" on my personal page? I don't want to display some of them to public.

Best,\\
Victor Lin
fields.summary: Is it possible to hide team from my personal page?

fields.description: The recent activity feed displays my user as having made all commits, regardless of who actually made them. The commits page shows the correct user.
fields.summary: Recent Activity Field - Wrong users

fields.description: http://img841.imageshack.us/img841/9529/20130525011913.png
fields.summary: Wrong ssh repo path for team repos

fields.description:
When I used the import repository email I received an error log. In it contains my plain text password.

16:33:51 fatal: https://xxxx%40gmail.com:mypassword@github.com/xxx/xxx.git/info/refs?service=git-upload-pack not
fields.summary: Plain Text Password in Error Log (BB-8649)

fields.description: In Chrome, when I try and select a branch to merge to for a PR, if I first enter some text to narrow list of branches and then use the mouse to select the branch, the wrong branch is selected.  If I use the arrows keys to navigate to my choice and hit enter it selects the correct branch.  But using the mouse doesn't work.
fields.summary: Clicking on a branch when creating a PR selects wrong branch after using finder (BB-8645)

fields.description:
Seen in Chrome with and without recently cleared cache.

Dots in UI indicating which branch a commit is on are missing from UI.  Cropped up on 5/24/2013.
fields.summary: Indicator dots missing in commit log UI (BB-8639)

fields.description: When configuring a wiki page I entered a number in the editor and the WIki viewer assumed it to be a commit message.  I could not find any way to enter the text 1108103 without it being considered a commit reference.
fields.summary: Error in commit reference detection

fields.description:
I identified a number of pull requests being 'reopened', and I'm unsure of how or why this would occur. The reopening was attributed to a particular developer in the 'activity' sections of the pull requests, but he did not actually reopen anything manually, nor does it seem like this is possible to do in the system.

Is there any explanation for this behavior?
fields.summary: Erroneous re-opening of old pull requests

fields.description:
Google instructs to place the tracking code before </head> in their help page:

https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/1008080?hl=en

If not, I cannot use their Webmaster Tools with Google Analytics together:

http://support.google.com/webmasters/bin/answer.py?hl=en&answer=185871&topic=2370564&ctx=topic
fields.summary: Move the Google Analytics tracking code in the head element

fields.description: After click on remove user access - screen displays processing icon for indefinite period - page is not refreshed or no message is displayed that access has been revoked.
fields.summary: Remove User Access (BB-8640)

fields.description:
Currently, the compare screen only shows the repo that was forked and the current repo.

Is it possible to make it show the parent of the forked repo, and/or the whole network of forks?
fields.summary: Compare screen should show all related repositories (BB-6474)

fields.description:
I can't add any reviewers to my Pull Request.

When I click the suggested user I get "*An unexpected error occurred*" in red text where the suggested reviewer was.

When I try to type a different user into the reviewer box and click on the user I get "*An unexpected error occurred*" in red text in the Reviewers text field.

This results in no reviewers. This has been this way for the last 2 hours or so. I was able to add reviewers to a different Pull request yesterday.
fields.summary: Error when Trying to Add Reviewer to Pull Request

fields.description: cannot load the library after installation due to a DLL error.
fields.summary: DLL Error

fields.description: Find or code a mediator map for robotlegs2 that allows us to register mediators manualy
fields.summary: Manual Mediator map

fields.description:
Hi, no matter what I try to do, I am not receiving email notifications about changes in issues that I have created. I have notifications turned on my profile and I am also added to the list under issues setting on the repository.\\
What's more interesting, my brother (peteradamek) is receiving those notifications even though he doesn't want and they are completely unrelated to him.\\
Can you please have a look what's wrong?

Thanks,\\
M
fields.summary: Not receiving email notifications from Issues

fields.description:
Hi,

We have four developers working with private repositories. On our Overview page we can see all our activities with proper account information, but on the Commits page one of our developers has shown as a foreign developer which even has not got access to our repo.

On Overview page our developer has name "Alexey Pavlov"\\
On Commits page we seeing him commiting as "Alexey Tkachenko"
fields.summary: Alien developer

fields.description:
We had a 25 people plan and one of our admins added the 26th user. He told me that he wasn't informed that this would go above our 25 people limit and was not aware that this would

* set all repositories to read only
* disable any ssh access at all

This caused a big disruption in our daily workflow until we were able to contact support, figure out what's wrong and get an upgrade on the account (the user with administrative privileges for this - me - was on vacation at that time) with some help.

Please, could you make it that:

* it's not possible to add the N+1 user or display a really fat warning that this will basically screw up bitbucket for everytone in the organization?
fields.summary: Adding the "one too much" user to your account can kill everyones access (BB-8641)

fields.description: We now have the ability to edit source from the UI. Could you also add the feature to create a new file?  This would be implemented similar to the Wiki pages.
fields.summary: Create New File from UI (BB-8637)

fields.description:
We use the post commit hook to read details of the last commit made. However, for commits with large number of files, the payload we receive has an empty "commits" list

Here's the repro:

# Clone the repository at https://bitbucket.org/kudutest/bitbucketlargepayload. It has a single commit that includes about 5000 files.
# Create a new Git repository on Bitbucket
# In this new repo, set up a POST hook from the services tab to point to a receiver (I used http://requestb.in/)
# Push the cloned repository to the new repo

Expected: The payload contains specifics about the commit

Actual: The commits field is empty. Here's what the payload looks like:

{ "canon_url": "https://bitbucket.org", *"commits": []*, "repository": { "absolute_url": "/kudutest/bitbucketlargepayload/", "fork": false, "is_private": false, "name": "BitbucketLargePayload", "owner": "kudutest", "scm": "git", "slug": "bitbucketlargepayload", "website": "" }, "truncated": true, "user": "kudutest" }

Consequent commits with fewer files correctly populate the "commits" field. I'm not sure if this is a recent change in behavior or if it has always been the case.
fields.summary: Git post commit hook payloads has empty commits field for large commits (BB-8636)

fields.description:
Hi Eric,\\
I would like to insert an image in Excel using OpenPyxl,I have made all the changes as you have suggested.The code gets compiled but I m not getting desired output.

Could you please help in fixing the bug..

Is it anything related to python version? I am using python 2.4.3
fields.summary: Inserting Image

fields.description:
Whenever I go to my dashboard, and click "Issues," I get the Issue dashboard. From there I can't create an issue or do anything useful except filter already-open issues.

A big tab link should go to the full Issues feature. The issue dashboard seems to offer less functionality than the full feature, but with no upside. The full feature isn't cluttered; it's useful.
fields.summary: Clicking "Issues" from dashboard gives a maimed version of issues

fields.description:
I'd like to be able to limit access so that a release manager could submit tags, but can't submit code changes. (Because our release manager also is a developer.) At some level I realize that this could be done with human process enforcement, but I'm wondering if the tool can provide an extra level of caution.

In fact, what I'd really like to do is be able to create a deployment key that allows pulling, _and tagging_, but nothing else. Is it possible?

Alternatively, a way to push a tag from the UI would be great.
fields.summary: limited tagging support

fields.description: we can't reach the site in mainland china
fields.summary: been blocked in China mainland

fields.description:
Hi,

Started from May 20th, we can not access git repo (https) from China anymore. Not sure if there is anything you can do, but I recalled I used godaddy before. The websites hosted on godaddy can be blocked from time to time. When this happened, normally I can call godaddy and they will fix the problem in several hours. Not sure how they did this though.

Thanks,\\
Jervis
fields.summary: bitbucket git repo can not be accessed from China anymore

fields.description: Navigate to a large pull request. Before the diff has finished loading, start typing some text in the comment box. When the diff finishes loading, the text field loses focus-- so if you don't notice and keep typing, you're likely to trigger some unwanted keyboard shortcut.
fields.summary: When PR content finishes loading, edit field focus is lost (BB-8627)
